history.created_by: LABEL description=Ubuntu 24.04 Golden Image with .NET Core 8.0, CIS and NIST security baseline
RUN |3 VERSION=0.0.1-init.1 BUILD_DATE=2025-01-04T22:09:25Z DOTNET_VERSION=8.0 /bin/sh -c ln -snf /usr/share/zoneinfo/$TZ /etc/localtime && echo $TZ > /etc/timezone # buildkit

RUN |3 VERSION=0.0.1-init.1 BUILD_DATE=2025-01-04T22:09:25Z DOTNET_VERSION=8.0 /bin/sh -c apt-get update && apt-get upgrade -y &&     apt-get install -y     apt-utils     ca-certificates     curl     gnupg     lsb-release     unattended-upgrades     apt-listchanges     auditd     apparmor     apparmor-utils     fail2ban     ufw     wget     software-properties-common     && apt-get clean     && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/* # buildkit

RUN |3 VERSION=0.0.1-init.1 BUILD_DATE=2025-01-04T22:09:25Z DOTNET_VERSION=8.0 /bin/sh -c wget https://packages.microsoft.com/config/ubuntu/24.04/packages-microsoft-prod.deb -O packages-microsoft-prod.deb &&     dpkg -i packages-microsoft-prod.deb &&     rm packages-microsoft-prod.deb &&     apt-get update &&     apt-get install -y dotnet-sdk-${DOTNET_VERSION} &&     apt-get clean &&     rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/* # buildkit

RUN |3 VERSION=0.0.1-init.1 BUILD_DATE=2025-01-04T22:09:25Z DOTNET_VERSION=8.0 /bin/sh -c echo "Implementing CIS security configurations..." &&     apt-get update &&     apt-get install -y openssh-server &&     apt-get clean &&     rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/* # buildkit

RUN |3 VERSION=0.0.1-init.1 BUILD_DATE=2025-01-04T22:09:25Z DOTNET_VERSION=8.0 /bin/sh -c for file in /etc/passwd /etc/group /etc/services; do         if [ -f "$file" ]; then chmod 644 "$file"; fi     done &&     if [ -f /etc/shadow ]; then chmod 000 /etc/shadow; fi &&     if [ -f /etc/ssh/sshd_config ]; then chmod 600 /etc/ssh/sshd_config; fi # buildkit
RUN |3 VERSION=0.0.1-init.1 BUILD_DATE=2025-01-04T22:09:25Z DOTNET_VERSION=8.0 /bin/sh -c ufw default deny incoming &&     ufw default allow outgoing &&     ufw logging on # buildkit

RUN |3 VERSION=0.0.1-init.1 BUILD_DATE=2025-01-04T22:09:25Z DOTNET_VERSION=8.0 /bin/sh -c sed -i 's/^space_left_action.*/space_left_action = email/' /etc/audit/auditd.conf &&     sed -i 's/^action_mail_acct.*/action_mail_acct = root/' /etc/audit/auditd.conf &&     sed -i 's/^admin_space_left_action.*/admin_space_left_action = halt/' /etc/audit/auditd.conf # buildkit

RUN |3 VERSION=0.0.1-init.1 BUILD_DATE=2025-01-04T22:09:25Z DOTNET_VERSION=8.0 /bin/sh -c echo "Configuring AppArmor..." &&     mkdir -p /etc/apparmor.d/disable &&     mkdir -p /etc/apparmor.d/local &&     mkdir -p /var/cache/apparmor # buildkit

RUN |3 VERSION=0.0.1-init.1 BUILD_DATE=2025-01-04T22:09:25Z DOTNET_VERSION=8.0 /bin/sh -c echo 'APT::Periodic::Update-Package-Lists "1";' > /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/20auto-upgrades &&     echo 'APT::Periodic::Unattended-Upgrade "1";' >> /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/20auto-upgrades # buildkit
RUN |3 VERSION=0.0.1-init.1 BUILD_DATE=2025-01-04T22:09:25Z DOTNET_VERSION=8.0 /bin/sh -c echo "Implementing NIST security configurations..." # buildkit

RUN |3 VERSION=0.0.1-init.1 BUILD_DATE=2025-01-04T22:09:25Z DOTNET_VERSION=8.0 /bin/sh -c sed -i 's/PASS_MAX_DAYS.*/PASS_MAX_DAYS   90/' /etc/login.defs &&     sed -i 's/PASS_MIN_DAYS.*/PASS_MIN_DAYS   7/' /etc/login.defs &&     sed -i 's/PASS_WARN_AGE.*/PASS_WARN_AGE   14/' /etc/login.defs # buildkit
RUN |3 VERSION=0.0.1-init.1 BUILD_DATE=2025-01-04T22:09:25Z DOTNET_VERSION=8.0 /bin/sh -c apt-get clean &&     rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/* /tmp/* /var/tmp/* # buildkit
RUN |3 VERSION=0.0.1-init.1 BUILD_DATE=2025-01-04T22:09:25Z DOTNET_VERSION=8.0 /bin/sh -c echo "umask 027" >> /etc/bash.bashrc # buildkit

Labels.description: Ubuntu 24.04 Golden Image with .NET Core 8.0, CIS and NIST security baseline
Labels.org.opencontainers.image.ref.name: ubuntu

Vulnerabilities.Title: coreutils: Non-privileged session can escape to the parent session in chroot
Vulnerabilities.Description: chroot in GNU coreutils, when used with --userspec, allows local users to escape to the parent session via a crafted TIOCSTI ioctl call, which pushes characters to the terminal's input buffer.

Vulnerabilities.Title: gnupg: denial of service issue (resource consumption) using compressed packets
Vulnerabilities.Description: GnuPG can be made to spin on a relatively small input by (for example) crafting a public key with thousands of signatures attached, compressed down to just a few KB.

Vulnerabilities.Title: krb5: Memory leak at /krb5/src/kdc/ndr.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) 1.21.2 contains a memory leak vulnerability in /krb5/src/kdc/ndr.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: krb5: Memory leak at /krb5/src/lib/rpc/pmap_rmt.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) 1.21.2 contains a memory leak in /krb5/src/lib/rpc/pmap_rmt.c.

Vulnerabilities.Title: krb5: Memory leak at /krb5/src/lib/gssapi/krb5/k5sealv3.c
Vulnerabilities.Description: Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) 1.21.2 contains a memory leak vulnerability in /krb5/src/lib/gssapi/krb5/k5sealv3.c.
sha256crypt and sha512crypt through 0.6 allow attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) because the algorithm's runtime is proportional to the square of the length of the password.
sha256crypt and sha512crypt through 0.6 allow attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) because the algorithm's runtime is proportional to the square of the length of the password.

Vulnerabilities.Title: libgcrypt: vulnerable to Marvin Attack
Vulnerabilities.Description: A timing-based side-channel flaw was found in libgcrypt's RSA implementation. This issue may allow a remote attacker to initiate a Bleichenbacher-style attack, which can lead to the decryption of RSA ciphertexts.

Vulnerabilities.Title: pam: libpam: Libpam vulnerable to read hashed password
Vulnerabilities.Description: A vulnerability was found in PAM. The secret information is stored in memory, where the attacker can trigger the victim program to execute by sending characters to its standard input (stdin). As this occurs, the attacker can train the branch predictor to execute an ROP chain speculatively. This flaw could result in leaked passwords, such as those found in /etc/shadow while performing authentications.

Vulnerabilities.Title: pam: Improper Hostname Interpretation in pam_access Leads to Access Control Bypass
Vulnerabilities.Description: A flaw was found in pam_access, where certain rules in its configuration file are mistakenly treated as hostnames. This vulnerability allows attackers to trick the system by pretending to be a trusted hostname, gaining unauthorized access. This issue poses a risk for systems that rely on this feature to control who can access certain services or terminals.

Vulnerabilities.Title: polkit: Program run via pkexec as unprivileged user can escape to parent session via TIOCSTI ioctl
Vulnerabilities.Description: pkexec, when used with --user nonpriv, allows local users to escape to the parent session via a crafted TIOCSTI ioctl call, which pushes characters to the terminal's input buffer.

Vulnerabilities.Title: polkit: Program run via pkexec as unprivileged user can escape to parent session via TIOCSTI ioctl
Vulnerabilities.Description: pkexec, when used with --user nonpriv, allows local users to escape to the parent session via a crafted TIOCSTI ioctl call, which pushes characters to the terminal's input buffer.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openssl: remote attackers (from the client side) to trigger unnecessarily expensive server-side DHE modular-exponentiation calculations
Vulnerabilities.Description: Validating the order of the public keys in the Diffie-Hellman Key Agreement Protocol, when an approved safe prime is used, allows remote attackers (from the client side) to trigger unnecessarily expensive server-side DHE modular-exponentiation calculations. The client may cause asymmetric resource consumption. The basic attack scenario is that the client must claim that it can only communicate with DHE, and the server must be configured to allow DHE and validate the order of the public key.

Vulnerabilities.Title: openssl: remote attackers (from the client side) to trigger unnecessarily expensive server-side DHE modular-exponentiation calculations
Vulnerabilities.Description: Validating the order of the public keys in the Diffie-Hellman Key Agreement Protocol, when an approved safe prime is used, allows remote attackers (from the client side) to trigger unnecessarily expensive server-side DHE modular-exponentiation calculations. The client may cause asymmetric resource consumption. The basic attack scenario is that the client must claim that it can only communicate with DHE, and the server must be configured to allow DHE and validate the order of the public key.

Vulnerabilities.Title: polkit: Program run via pkexec as unprivileged user can escape to parent session via TIOCSTI ioctl
Vulnerabilities.Description: pkexec, when used with --user nonpriv, allows local users to escape to the parent session via a crafted TIOCSTI ioctl call, which pushes characters to the terminal's input buffer.

Vulnerabilities.Title: wget: authorization header disclosure on redirect
Vulnerabilities.Description: GNU Wget through 1.21.1 does not omit the Authorization header upon a redirect to a different origin, a related issue to CVE-2018-1000007.

Vulnerabilities.Description: NET, .NET Framework, and Visual Studio Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
